tldr: The author, William Huggins, observed the spectrum of Comet 1, 1866, and discovered that the light from the coma of the comet was different from the light emitted by its nucleus. The nucleus was self-luminous and possibly made of ignited gas, while the coma reflected sunlight. The continuous spectrum of the coma's light suggested that it was made of fog or cloud-like matter. Huggins also found that the bright line in the spectrum of the comet corresponded to the brightest line of nitrogen, which might indicate that cometary matter is made of nitrogen or a more elementary substance.
